poem:
### Suburban Ferocity

In suburbia's soft shadow,  
Hutch dances –  
    forgotten trash,  
angle of lawn,  
   tugging his chains  
of commonplace.  
Yet beneath the mild delay,  
  fists tighten,  
unseen cables drawn taut,  
  snapping sudden  
in a symphony  
of violence.  
A thud, a chore complete –  
the quiet rage  
of nobody's pulse.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Nobody 2 review – Bob Odenkirk’s suburban tough guy beats action sequel into submission Bob Odenkirk’s unlikely new career journey as a kickass tough guy continues in this pretty formulaic and forgettable sequel to the amusing original hit, which first showed us Hutch (Odenkirk), an apparent suburban nobody with wife-plus-kids who keeps forgetting to put the garbage out in time – then from nowhere busts out some serious fight moves. This sequel from Indonesian action". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
